programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Des racines & des ailes
programme.desc: All the flavour of Quebec Exploring the city of Quebec, all the way to the Saguenay Fjords National Park, in deep mid-winter then in autumn as the forest dons its most vibrant colours. With historian and photographer Pierre Lahoud, we fly over the icebound Saint Lawrence, one of the world's most dangerous navigable waterways. Directed by: Lucile Bellanger (France, 2021)

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Aurora, Ontario
Louis goes to Aurora, in Ontario, to sort out a raccoon problem. The moment he arrives, he realises that it will be a real game of hide-and-seek.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Somme Bay Lying on the Picardy coast, the Somme Bay, one of the most beautiful in the world, is a vast reservoir of natural wonders, notably recognised for the wealth of its bird life. An invitation to wander the landscapes of Picardy, to discover Saint Valéry and the gardens of Valloires Abbey. Directed by: Pierre Chassagnieux (season 1, France, 2014)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Charente, surprising heritage Exploring the Charente through its unique sites and fascinating characters. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Toronto, Ontario
It's the season of babies! Louis' telephone hardly stops ringing... everyone thinks they have raccoons or squirrels in their walls or roof.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Quebec flavour for far away recipes The chefs Victor Soto, from the restaurant Tacos Victor, and Paul Toussaint, from the restaurant Kamùy, give recipes from other countries a distinctly Quebec twist. Fabien Cloutier and Johanne Despins have the pleasure of tasting these new culinary creations. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Choosing the right merguez sausage
If the merguez, a spicy sausage originally from North Africa, is made from lamb, sometimes from veal or from beef, in reality it's often made from beef and/or pork... Also on the programme: Isabelle Marquis analyses four new products, a plateful of weeds and all about cranberries.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Tofu
It may be inexpensive and easy to prepare, but tofu continues to remain unloved. A handy guide to buying and preparing it. Also: testing indoor gardens, Korean kogo and tips on presenting simple dishes to make them even more attractive...
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.sub-title: MOBILIER NATIONAL, T.LEMAIRE/ARCHI DECO, VERCINGETORIX, TONNELLERIE
programme.desc: Programme summary: - Behind the scenes at the Mobilier National in Paris - Encounter with Thierry Lemaire, French interior designer - Following the trail of Vercingétorix in Paris - Focus on the art of barrel-making Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: The Pays d'Auge In the heart of the Calvados, the Pays d'Auge is a veritable concentration of Normandy with a thousand and one wonders in a remarkably small area. Honfleur, a superb fishing port and tourist capital; the Lisieux Basilica, the most important pilgrimage destination after Lourdes; the majestic Le Pin Stud... Directed by: Amaury Velter (season 1, France, 2014)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Charente, surprising heritage Exploring the Charente through its unique sites and fascinating characters. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Bergeracois
The Bergeracois, the region around Bergerac, opens its doors with Séverine who produces honey and walnuts. Muriel takes us on a guided visit of her vines, a wine estate dating back over 200 years. Yannick and Céline offer a chance to go forest bathing.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Dole, with or without an accent? Dole, in Jura, is the former capital of Franche-Comté. Dole or Dôle? Without an accent. Officially written as Dôle until the 1960s, people here tend to lengthen the "o" in words like vélo or photo, as we'll see in the programme... Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.sub-title: Que cache le bas prix des bananes ?
programme.desc:
What hides behind the price of bananas?
The banana is one of the most frequently-eaten fruits and one of the cheapest. How are prices kept so low? And should it be cause for celebration? Also on the programme: testing non-stick pans, a spirit made from whey and manioc in every shape and form.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Programme summary: - Behind the scenes at the Pic du Midi de Bigorre - Encounter with the globetrotting artist Nicolas Lefebvre - Paris, real or illusion? - Focus on the designer Laura Cambon and her creative glasswork Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Le goût des rencontres normandes
programme.desc:
Trout with almonds in Saint-Wandrille-Rançon
David Gallienne has a rendezvous at the Le Fontenelle fish farm in Saint-Wandrille-Rançon, Seine-Maritime. In charge is Adélie, who invites him to discover this age-old site where she raises thousands of fish. On the menu: trout cooked with almonds.
Presented by: David Gallienne.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life as a modern hermit Julien stops off with Guy Boudreau who lives alone in the heart of the boreal forest of North Shore. Experienced mountain guide and adventurer, Guy spent fifteen years building his remote camp, far off the beaten track and the nearest road. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Programme summary: - Behind the scenes at the Unesco building - Encounter with Pierre Bonnefille, designer and Maître d'Art - Paris, in the footsteps of Honoré de Balzac - Encounter with Delphine Lescuyer, mosaicist Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Cornouaille The south-western tip of the Finistère, home to remarkable towns steeped in character: Concarneau's towering ramparts, Locronan's granite houses, Le Guilvinec and the gentle ballet of its trawlers. A voyage for those who love invigorating landscapes and unspoilt nature, that is certain to charm all who love age-worn buildings. Directed by: Sigrid Clément (season 1, France, 2014)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Charente, surprising heritage Exploring the Charente through its unique sites and fascinating characters. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Paname
programme.desc:
Rue du Temple
The Rue du Temple, one of the oldest streets in Paris, connects the Hôtel de Ville to the Place de la République. We focus on its upper areas: the Sainte-Avoye district, criss-crossed by small narrow streets where heavy portes-cochères open to reveal private mansions or workshops buzzing with activity.
Presented by: Yvan Hallouin.

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Dal and raviolis
To prepare smoked salmon raviolis and dal with sweet potato spirals, Ricardo makes life easy with shop-bought ingredients.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
The roadside diners of the Lower St Lawrence
In the Lower St Lawrence region, two roadside diners offer a menu where seafood takes centre stage. Who could resist a visit! We also discover peameal bacon, Charlotte's market and join tourists on the trail of good food in Montreal and Ottawa...
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Programme summary: - Behind the scenes at the Assemblée Nationale - Encounter with Sophie Mainier-Jullerot, gallery owner - A theatrical trip through Paris - Encounter with Lucie de Syracuse, visual artist Presented by: Katherina Marx.
